question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and expert responses. Make sure that the code you provide is executable for demonstration. Please help me implement this SVG image using code. Music is played on a cassette tape.

checklist.title: Is the basic SVG structure properly implemented?
checklist.description: Check if the code includes proper SVG structure with appropriate namespaces, viewport dimensions, and responsive design considerations. The SVG should have a well-defined viewBox for scaling. Deduct 5 points if namespace declarations are missing, 5 points if viewBox is incorrectly defined, and 3 points if responsive attributes are absent. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the cassette tape visually accurate and detailed?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the cassette tape is accurately represented with proper proportions and all key components (case, reels, tape, label area, etc.). Deduct 3 points for each missing critical component, 5 points if the proportions are significantly off, and 2 points if fine details like screw holes or write-protection notches are missing. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the music visualization appropriately implemented?
checklist.description: Review how music is visually represented in the context of the cassette tape. Check if there are visual elements that convincingly represent music playing (e.g., animated tape movement between reels, equalizer bars, sound waves). Deduct 5 points if no music visualization is present, 3 points if the visualization is static rather than animated, and 2 points if the visualization doesn't logically connect to the cassette concept. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the animation smooth and relevant to cassette tape functionality?
checklist.description: Judge if the animations (tape movement, reels rotating, etc.) match the realistic mechanics of a cassette tape. The animation should run at an appropriate speed and include proper easing functions. Deduct 5 points for jerky animations, 3 points for physically inaccurate movements, and 3 points if no animation timing control is implemented. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as browser compatibility issues, responsive scaling, performance optimization for animations). Code with strong robustness should implement proper error handling and fallbacks. Deduct 3 points for each unhandled edge case, 5 points for browser-specific code without alternatives, and 5 points for performance issues with animations. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Interactive controls to play/pause/fast-forward 2. Realistic tape counter 3. Sound visualization effects synchronized with actual audio playback). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant SVG elements that could be grouped or reused 2. Excessive detail that compromises performance 3. Fancy effects unrelated to cassette tape functionality. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core visual representation is obscured by unnecessary elements.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular organization (such as separating static elements from animated ones), reusability of components, and maintainability. Deduct 5 points if elements that should be grouped are scattered; deduct 5 points if repetitive code is used instead of loops or functions for similar elements; deduct 5 points if there are no comments explaining complex parts. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the visual design meet professional standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the design follows modern SVG best practices: 1) Appropriate use of gradients, shadows, and highlights for realistic appearance 2) Proper proportion and perspective 3) Thoughtful color palette that creates a cohesive look. Deduct 3 points for flat, unrealistic rendering, 5 points for inconsistent light source/shadows, and 5 points for poor use of color theory. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the interaction design intuitive and engaging?
checklist.description: Judge whether user interactions (if implemented) follow intuitive patterns: 1) Clear visual feedback for interactive elements 2) Appropriate hover/click states 3) Logical connection between interactions and cassette functionality. Deduct 5 points for unclear interaction targets, 3 points for missing visual feedback, and 5 points for unintuitive control mechanisms. The full score is 10 points.
